NCBC-1618: A worker thread may en-queue a config after the queue has been
disposed

Motivation
----------
After the BlockingQueue for the config manager has been disposed, the
blocking enumuration is still waiting for a config - This will result in a
NullArgumentException or an ObjectDisposedException being thrown.

Modifications
-------------
 - Place code within a try/catch and log exception at DEBUG level

Result
------
This is expected behavior - the exception should be handled.

Change-Id: I705fd058db55a00c534eea599d2e73c8254b5a06
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/87497
Reviewed-by: Mike Goldsmith <goldsmith.mike@gmail.com>
Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>

NCBC-1602: Implement Certificate Authentication for KV

Motivation
----------
Allows for x509 certificates to be used for authenticating the client with the
server. Only works for K/V; Views, Analytics, FTS and N1QL are not currently supported.
Requires that X509 certificates are generated and installed on the server and
a client .pfx be generated from the public key and is installed on the
application server.

Modifications
-------------
 - Updated SslConnection so that if EnableCertificateAuthentication is
   enabled and a CertifcateFactory exists, the client will use them to
   authenticate.
 - By pass authentication in ConnectionPoolBase if
   EnableCertificateAuthentication.
 - Added the EnableCerificateAuthentcation flag to BucketConfiguration and
   related configuration classes.
 - Added CertifcateFactory that provides generic implementatations
   of Func<X509CertifcateCollection2> for fetching x509 certs from disk
   and cert store.
 - Added CertificateFactoryTests.cs for testing the CertificateFactory.

Result
------
The client can authenticate with the server using X509 certificates if
they are properly configured. Only K/V is supported - Views and N1QL does
support certificate authentication. See
https://developer.couchbase.com/documentation/server/current/security/security-x509certsintro.html
for details.

Change-Id: I8e4b48a2d98c90586ae70f9b7e3084141da0bb81
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/87131
Reviewed-by: Mike Goldsmith <goldsmith.mike@gmail.com>
Reviewed-by: Jeffry Morris <jeffrymorris@gmail.com>
Tested-by: Jeffry Morris <jeffrymorris@gmail.com>

NCBC-1612: Use synchronous DNS resolution where possible

Motivation
----------
Calls to Dns.GetHostEntryAsync from synchronous methods can cause
deadlocks due to thread pool depletion, especially if under load during
boostrapping.

Modifications
-------------
Add a netstandard2.0 target framework to the NuGet package. Adjusted
some package versions based upon the move to NetStandard.Library 2.0.1.

For netstandard2.0 and net45 targets, use Dns.GetHostEntry instead of
Dns.GetHostEntryAsync.

Added netcoreapp2.0 target for unit and integration tests.

Results
-------
For .NET Core 2.0 and .NET Desktop applications, thread pool depletion
related to DNS resolution is eliminated.

For .NET Core 1.0/1.1 applications the problem still remains.

Change-Id: Iea9014dbc89021d19e31534a9412e115e2fa9ed6

NCBC-1615: Upsert in memcached bucket incorrectly converts expiration

Motivation
----------
Fixes a bug where the expiration was being converted incorrectly causing
the expiration to not work correctly.

Modifications
-------------
 - Removed ToTtl() call on expiration
 - Updated unit test

Result
------
Upsert k/v properly expires purging it from the bucket.

Change-Id: Ieb3fabb6aa4291299f8505b9afb75bed9fb343e6
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/87232
Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>
Reviewed-by: Mike Goldsmith <goldsmith.mike@gmail.com>

NCBC-1613: Config processing thread is never terminated

Motivation
----------
The config thread uses a BlockingCollection as a queue; the
BlockingCollection is never emptied so the thread could block there,
waiting for more items.

Modifications
-------------
Update the Dispose method so that the queue is flagged to not accept any
more items. Then remove any items that haven't been processed, finally
call Dispose on the BlockingCollection.

Result
------
The config thread should safely exit because the BlockingCollection is no
longer waiting for new items.

Change-Id: Ib4123afd25713c91ef7c7a6edeb537bcc69a29fb
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/87351
Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>
Reviewed-by: Mike Goldsmith <goldsmith.mike@gmail.com>

NCBC-1550: Add reuseable operation retry logic to Request Executors

MOTIVATION
----------
To reduce duplicated code, we can create reuseable retry utility methods
in the RequestExecutor classes.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- Add utility methods to RequestExecutorBase that inheriting classes can
  use for retrying operations
- Use the new code blocks in CouchbaseRequestExecutor for all operation
  types and remove unused code

RESULT
------
There are reuseable code blocks in RequestExecutorBase that inheriting
classes can take advantage of.

Change-Id: I2b71e24987b6299545842503247f0091ee648e9b
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/86575
Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>
Reviewed-by: Jeffry Morris <jeffrymorris@gmail.com>

NCBC-1614: Preload VBucketServerMap.IPEndPoints after deserialization

Motivation
----------
Calls to GetIPEndPoint while populating VBucketServerMap.IPEndPoints can
cause thread pool depletion in some scenarios under high load.

Modifications
-------------
After deserializing VBucketServerMap, prepopulate the values in
IPEndPoints.

Results
-------
Since VBucketServerMap is generally deserialized during bootstrap (an
inherently single threaded operation) or on the configuration processing
thread, the risk of thread pool depletion due to getting
VBucketServerMap.IPEndPoints should be greatly reduced or eliminated.

Change-Id: I05ca5082132648a6088a6c9e64af22f97f5c2735
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/87176
Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>
Reviewed-by: Mike Goldsmith <goldsmith.mike@gmail.com>

NCBC-1593: Read mutation token for non-generic operations

MOTIVATION
----------
When executing a Delete operation which is based on OperationBase and
mutation tokens are enabled, the result has an empty mutation token
which causes the operation to fail durability checks.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- try to read the response body using ReadExtras virtual method when
  processing responses in OperationBase
- add unit tests for both Remove and RemoveAsync to verify behaviour

RESULT
------
Operations that inherit OperationBase will try to read extras when
processing the result which includes reading the mutation token.

Change-Id: I0630bb7802ed70616b196a6a1bf5cc918e706b34
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/87095
Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>
Reviewed-by: Jeffry Morris <jeffrymorris@gmail.com>

NCBC-1573: Add HealthCheck API

MOTIVATION
----------
Add implementation for HealthCheck API that can gather connectivity
details from the client's perspective.

There are two parts to the API:
1) Cluster level DiagnosticReport that will collection details
including last activity for each service
2) Bucket level ping that will interact with each service by sending a
NOOP style request and recording latency.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- Add Diagnostics methods to ICluster and implementations Cluster
- Add Ping API to IBucket and implementations to CouchbaseBucket
  and MemcacheBucket
- Add IDiagnosticReport, DiagnosticReport, IPingReport, PingReport,
  IEndpointDiagnostics and EndpointDiagnostics
- Add DiagnosticsReportProvider to manage creation of reports
- Add LastActivity and UpdateLastActivity method to HttpServiceBase and
  ConnectionBase
- Update Connection, MultiplexingConnection and SSLConnection to use
  UpdateLastActivity when executng an operation
- Update SearchClient, QueryClient, ViewClient and AnalyticsClient to
  use UpdateLastActivity for query operations
- Expose IAnalyticsClient to IServer and change private field to
  property in Server implementation
- Add unit and integration tests to verify behaviour

RESULTS
-------
The cluster Diagnostics API can be used to generate a cluster level
connectivity report and the Bucket level API can be used to record
service latencies.

Change-Id: I17e0a68ca52657c32f9f53aa8165deeecfa2ad6e
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/85764
Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>
Reviewed-by: Jeffry Morris <jeffrymorris@gmail.com>

NCBC-1608: Log query context ID when writing query timings

MOTIVATION
----------
QueryTimer logs timing information for a particular query, however the
query context ID is not included which can make it difficult to
correlate with other log entries.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- store and include the query context ID when writing query timings to
  the log
- move QueryTimer tests from Couchbase.Tests to Couchbase.UnitTests
- copy Couchbase.Tests.Fakes.FakeLog to Couchbase.UnitTests

RESULT
------
When writing query timings to the log, the query context ID is included
to help correlate with other log messages.

Change-Id: Ib8d08b212285a107fbf421b5437c594a5f7c88cd
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/86714
Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>
Reviewed-by: Jeffry Morris <jeffrymorris@gmail.com>

NCBC-1531: Update View retry logic to match spec

MOTIVATION
----------
The view retry specification indicates that view requests should be
retried under certain conditions. These conditions are a combination of
status code and/or error message.

The specification for view retry behaviour is here:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GhRxvPb7xakLL4g00FUi6fhZjiDaP33DTJZW7wfSxrI/edit

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- mark IViewRequest.CannotRetry as obsolete in favour of
  IRequest.ShouldRetry
- update CouchbaseRequestExecutor to use IRequest.ShouldRetry and
  refactor checks to see if views are available
- add unit tests to verify retry behaviour

RESULT
------
The view client reties view requests according the specification.

Change-Id: Ic61db06be5f18d2ca50ab274d545d5f0e55dd641
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/83679
Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>

MOTIVATION
----------
The SearchQueryResult class has an internal constructor that takes a
HttpClient and stores in a local variable. This is not used and has no
purpose.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- remove constructor, local variable and remove don't dispose during

RESULT
------
The unused constructor has been removed.

NCBC-1607: Don’t update context ID when logging query request

MOTIVATION
----------
A queries context ID should not be updated when being logged via
ToString() to maintain correlelation between log entries.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- add private overload for GetFormValues that takes a bool to indicate
  if a new ID should be generated with a default of true
- only generate new ID if new parameter is true
- add private overloads for GetFormValuesAsJson that passes in the new
  parameter to indicate if a new ID should be generated
- update ToString overload to use new GetFormValuesAsJson(false)
- add unit test to verify behaviour

RESULT
------
The query context ID is not updated when logging the query via and using
the ToString method.

Motivation
----------
Use GlobalTimeout property instead of _operationLifespanTimeout field in
IBucket implementations.

Modifications
-------------
 - Update MemcachedBucket to only use GlobalTimeout.

Result
------
MemcachedBucket has consistent usage of GlobalTimeout.

NCBC-1555: DecodeString method doesn't manage null string

Motivation
----------
The DefaultTranscoder would use an empty string when instead it should use
null when a value is null for a key.

Modifications
-------------
 - Change DecodeString to return null instead of an empty string when the
   body of the response is empty.

 - Add DefaultTranscoderTests to Couchbase.UnitTests

Result
------
If a key is stored without a value for a string, the SDK will respect this
and not return an empty string; null will be returned instead.

NCBC-1603: Fix unit tests in CouchbaseRequestExecutorTests

Motivation
----------
The test WhenForwardMapIsAvailable_AndRevisionIsZero_OperationUsesVBucket in
CouchbaseRequestExecutorTests would randomly fail; the issue appears to be
because the wrong port was being used (8901 instead of 8091).

Modifications
-------------
Change the port in the tests from 8901 to 8091.

Result
------
Test passes successfully.

Change-Id: I419036ca343ef97e25da59e017a215b2e02af258
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/86420
Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>
Reviewed-by: Mike Goldsmith <goldsmith.mike@gmail.com>

NCBC-1600: Correctly parse hostname during bootstrap

MOTIVATION
----------
Bootstrapping is failing when connecting to a Couchbase Cluster using
IPv4 addresses. This is because the NodeExt can have a null or empty
value so the Node.Hostname is used, however this value can include the
port which needs to be removed.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- parse the hostname and strip port if present in host, IPv4 and IPv6
  addresses
- add unit tests to verify hostname is correctly parsed for a mixture of
  host, IPv4 and IPv6 including both with and without ports

RESULT
------
When creating a NodeAdapter the hostname is correctly parsed and strips
the port from both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

Change-Id: Iee01a0a9cc33aeab632644cc70c02d89ecc43249
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/86325
Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>
Reviewed-by: Jeffry Morris <jeffrymorris@gmail.com>

NCBC-1596: Fix failing integration tests

MOTIVATION
----------
There are some failing integration tests when running against Couchbase
Server 5.0  These are a mix of bugs, configuration and known issues.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- update ConnectionPoolBase to return the FailedUserAuth message
  instead of bucket for a failed SelectBucekt op, it has to be user
  because SelectBucket is only used for RBAC which requires users
- try to get the first connection which has already been created in
  MultiplexingConnectionPool and SharedConnectionPool constructors,
  otherwise use Aquire to create a new connection
- use the basic configuration for KV SSL tests because the default
  configuration (muxio) forces a multiplexing IO service which is not
  compatible with SSL
- update a Password auth tests to check the first error in the
  AggregateException for the expected message
- ignore known issue with temporay lock failure messages
- update a memcached test to expect the new BootstrapException to be
  returned when failing bootstrap instead of AggregateException
- fix query for new RAW keyword with streaming and remove adhoc(false)
  parmetere as it's not supported in 5.0 due to MB-26175

RESULT
------
All integration tests pass successfully when running against Couchbase
Server 5.0.

Change-Id: Ib03d0c7ded76156793e8652e642daed560893b59
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/86259
Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>
Reviewed-by: Jeffry Morris <jeffrymorris@gmail.com>

NCBC-1583: UnsupportedAddressFamilyException when parsing IPv6 URI

Motivation
----------
This patch fixes several related issues in the SDK for using it with IPv6.

Modifications
-------------
In general, this patch updates any IPv4 related URI parsing/creation to
support IPv6 addresses:

 - Update UriUtil to determine the address family so that the correct
   URI's formats can be used.
 - Update IPEndPointExtensions so that the correct IPEndPoint formatting
   is used for the address family of the string address.
 - INodeAdapter and NodeAdapter: remove dependency on IPv4 addresses and
   add property that identifies the AddressFamily that the remote host is
   using/supporting.

Results
-------
Basic K/V works on both IPv4 and IPv6 enabled Couchbase Servers.

Change-Id: I187cee41f3738c6fe46e4a71e2b5abddb6658477

NCBC-1598: Update nuget package title to 2.5

MOTIVATION
----------
When building the Couchbase nuget package, it uses the Title property
from the csproj, which is currently set as 2.4.

We're now in the 2.5 series of releases and should be updated to 2.5.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- update Couchbase.csproj's Title property to 2.5

RESULT
------
The Couchbase nuget package title is "Couchbase 2.5" when built.

NCBC-1597: Use correct config value for N1QL query timeouts

MOTIVATION
----------
The timeout for N1QL queries uses ViewRequestTimeout where it should
use QueryRequestTimeout.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- use QueryRequestTimeout configuration value in
  CouchbaseRequestExecutor

RESULT
------
The timeout used for N1QL queries uses the QueryRequestTimeout
configuration value.

NCBC-1549: Add async creation of buckets.

Motivation
----------
Buckets cannot be created asynchronously at the moment and being able
to do this could be a big win under a high load.

Modifications
-------------
 - Added OpenBucketAsync to ICluster
 - Added CreateBucketAsync to IClusterController
 - Added unit tests for the OpenBucket methods of Cluster.
 - Added GetBucketAsync to ClusterHelper and changed the locking logic in that class.

Result
------
Buckets can now be created asynchronously :)

Change-Id: I474332ddf1d76da65ff7ad1a1541756521abb9b7
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/84074
Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>
Reviewed-by: Mike Goldsmith <goldsmith.mike@gmail.com>

NCBC-1587 Support for controlling how MemoryStreams are created

MOTIVATION
----------
This PR adds the ability to configure how MemoryStream instances are
created within the Couchbase SDK, while maintaining compatibility
with how MemoryStreams instances are created. This change allows users
to plug in their own more memory efficient MemoryStream
implementations.

For example: Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream
https://github.com/Microsoft/Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- Added the MemoryStreamFactory that can use a configured function
  to create MemoryStream instances
- Default implementation does not differ from current, new
  MemoryStream() is called
- In instances where new MemoryStream() was being called, replaced with
  MemoryStreamFactory.GetMemoryStream()
- In instances where new MemoryStream(byte[]) was being called, no
  changes were made: MemoryStreams are being used in a read-only capacity.

RESULT
------
There is now a MemoryStreamFactory that is used to retrieve a
MemoryStream that supports plugging in custom implementations.

Change-Id: I5cd3d3325cd1202618fd5d02c2b46043f8014d52
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/85863
Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>

Reviewed-by: Jeffry Morris <jeffrymorris@gmail.com>

NCBC-1576: MemcachedBucket.Upsert TTL is set to 0 - causing infinite lifetime

Motivation
----------
Fixes a bug where an overload for MemcachedBucket.Upsert would cast the
uint expiration to a TimeSpan and then from a double back to an uint
losing precision.

Modification
------------
 - Remove initial call to ToTTL
 - Add unit test

Results
-------
The epiration is properly set.

Change-Id: I045547fd2284d908694a3f1c1c66d66e25427863

NCBC-1581: Password is written to log at INFO level

Motivation
----------
Fixes a bug where the password for the bucket may be written to the output
log if log level INFO is specified.

Modifications
-------------
 - Flag BucketConfig.Password as non-serializable.
 - Add unit test

Result
------
The password is no longer written to the log.`

Change-Id: I966b43ebb42b9137119f81ecfa05c28d403ae2c3

Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>
Reviewed-by: Mike Goldsmith <goldsmith.mike@gmail.com>

NCBC-1556: Stop trying CarrierPublication if not supported

Motivation
----------
Memcached buckets do not support CarrierPublication (CCCP)
configuration and will always fail and should stop trying to use it in
subsequent configuration requests if the server returns UnknownCommand
response.

Modification
------------
- Remove ConfigException which was thrown if bucket didn't recognize the
  CCCP Config operation
- When Config operation response code is UnknownCommand, Log Info message
  and break loop attempting to use CarrierPublication
- Capture AggregateException in ClusterController and add inner
  exceptions to local exceptions list
- Throw BootstrapException if unable to successfully get a config using
  CarrierPublication
- Add unit test to ensure a BootstrapException is thrown if a Config
  operation response status is UnknownCommand

Result
------
When a client receives UnknownCommand response status when trying to
bootstrap with CarrierPublication (CCCP), it will no longer throw a
ConfigException and will break from attempting to use that config
provider.

Change-Id: Ie8f403459a45aeef23448c237f7889f4aff934bc
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/84453
Reviewed-by: Mike Goldsmith <goldsmith.mike@gmail.com>

----------
The test coverage for a number of important classes in the root

- Add unit test coverage for ClusterInfo, Cluster, CouchbaseBucket,

The test coverage on classes in the root namespace has improved with

NCBC-1570: Implement Memcached.Upsert for multiple items including timeout

MOTIVATION
----------
Memcached.Upsert with a dictionary of keys and objects, ParallelOptions
and a TimeSpan should be implemented and not return

not provide a timeout because it uses the above overload internally.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- add implementation for MemcachedBucket.Upsert that takes a dictionary

RESULT
------
Memcached.Upsert when passing a dictionary of keys and objects,
ParallelOptions and a TimeSpan is now implemented and does not return a

NCBC-1585: Remove locks around multiplexing connection states in flight

MOTIVATION
----------
There are lock statements around adding and removing AsyncState's to
the in flight ConcurrentDictionary in MultiplexingConnection. These are
not required because ConcurrentDictionary is already thread safe.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- remove lock statements wrapping adding or removing entries to the in
  flight dictionary

RESULT
------
There are no longer lock statements around adding or removing
entries to the in flight AsyncState ConcurrentDictionary.

Change-Id: Idcaecb451e8d0b2d16a44e9ec73114dabcc48919

NCBC-1575: Add info to CarrierPublication to use forceSasl for LDAP

MOTIVATION
----------
SCRAM is not supported when using LDAP user authentication and an
exception is caught and logged. It would be beneficial to include some
additional instructions in the log to tell the user to set the
forceSaslPlain setting to true if using LDAP.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- extend log message when catching AuthenticationException in
  CarrierPublicationProvider to check set forceSaslPlain if using LDAP

RESULT
------
When an AuthenticationException is caught during CCCP bootstrap, the log
indicates that if using LDAP the forceSaslPlain setting should be set to
true.

Motivation
----------
The BinaryTranscoder class does not have a constructor that does not
accept params of IByteConverter and ITypeSerializer.

Modifications
-------------
 - Add CTORs and call base implementation
 - Add unit test to verify

Results

BinaryTranscoder can be created via TransCoderFactory.

Change-Id: Ic5ddd69d716c0c97da61f16325dae0487a9dbe86

NCBC-1575: Add config to force SASL PLAIN authentication

MOTIVATION
----------
Couchbase Server 5.0 introduced RBAC to provide fine-grained user
controls, which also included authenticating with an external source, eg
LDAP. However, the LDAP integration only supports PLAIN SASL and the
client always uses the most secure authentication mechanism the server
supports.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- Create forceSaslPlain property in ClientConfiguration and
  PoolConfiguration with default of false
- Enable new configuration to be read from configuration file
- Check forceSaslPlain property in SaslFactory, if true return
  PlainMechanism without querying for supported mechanisms
- Add tests for both configuration and SaslFactory

RESULT
------
There is now a configuration property that can be used to force PLAIN
SASL authentication for KV connections. The configuration property can
be set via configuration file or directly using code.

NCBC-1559: Invalid default timeout is set for Memcached Upsert

Motivation
----------
MemcachedBucket.Upsert(key, value) has a bug where the expiration is set
to the GlobalTimeout value and instead of the key having an infinite
timeout, it times out nearly immediately causing the key to be evicted
from the bucket.
Other overloads and operations do not appear to be impacted; the work
around is to use any of the other overloads.

Modifications
-------------
Changed default value for expiration to be TimeSpan.Zero which will be in
an infinite expiration for the given key.

Results
-------
Fixes bug where the GlobalTimeout (2500ms) for the operation is used
instead of the expiration of TimeSpan.Infinite. Keys inserted with this
method will have infinite lifetimes.

NCBC-1502: Remove invalid query plans for failed requets and update
retry logic

MOTIVATION
----------
Failed query requests should be checked to see if the locally cached
query plan should be invalidated. Additionally, the retry behaviour for
N1QL queries should be at the request executor leve and not within
QueryClient.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- Add PreparedStatementNotFound to ErrorPrepared N1QL error messages
  enum
- Add QueryResultExtensions that contains contains IsQueryPlanStale to
  check if a query plan is stale
- Check for and remove stale query plans after executing a N1QL query in
  QueryClient.ExecuteAsync
- Update QueryResult.ShouldRetry to indicate if a query should be
  retried because of status code and/or message
- Update CouchbaseRequestExeutor to use request.ShouldRetry and
  request.IsAdhoc in logic for retries
- Update tests to use ShouldRetry instead of QeryClient.CanRetry
- Add unit tests for QueryResultExtensions

RESULT
------
Whenever a prepared N1QL request failed, it's result is checked to see
if the locally cached query plan should be invalidated. Also, the retry
logic for N1QL requests has been moved to CouchbaseRequestExecutor level
instead of within QueryClient.

NCBC-1494: Update subdoc XATTR API to match RFC

MOTIVATION
----------
The current implementation of subdoc XATTR support along with other
additional functionality does not follow the RFC. The main issues are
that the subdoc path and document flags are expected to be passed in
unique bytes and that the meaning / value of the flags are mixed
together. Also, the doc flags byte should be omitted if no flags are
set.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- Refactor SubdocLookupInFlags and SubdocMutateInFlags to
  SubdocPathFlags and SubdocDocFlags with expected entries and values
- Update IMutateInBuilder, ILookupInBuilder, MutateInBuilder and
  LookupInBuilder to accept the new style flags in place of the old
- Replace the Flags byte on OperationSpec with two flags fields
- Calculate the correct extras length if there are doc flags in
  SubdocSinglularBase
- Set the path and doc flags bytes in SubdocSingularLookupBase and
  SubdocSingluarMutationBase
- Update all unit and integration tests to use the new style flags

RESULT
------
The subdoc XATTR API now matches the RFC and is able to perform all the
expected operations outlines in the spec.

NCBC-1498: Make MultiplexIOService work with RBAC

MOTIVATION
----------
MultiplexIOService doesn't work with RBAC because it doesn't perform
the SelectBucket operation during bootstrap. This is because connection
pool is initialized before the IOService is created and this is what
indicates if EnhancedAuthentication is required.

Also, ConnectionPool will created mizSize +1 connections because the
first connection is not counted during initalize.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- Ensure all existing connections are both authenticated and
  perform the SelectBucket operations during initialize
- Use _refs.Count instead of _store.Count to work out how many
  additional connections to create
- Execute ConnectionPool.Initalize after IOService has bootstrapped
  to make sure EnhancedAuthentication property is set to indicate
  the connections need to do the SelectBucket operation

RESULT
------
MultiplexIOService correctly executes the SelectBucket operation
before performing operations.

NCBC-1486: HttpStreamingProvider RBAC support

Motivation
----------
The HttpStreamingProvider does not currently support RBAC
authentication with Couchbase Server 5.0. This can cause bootstrapping
to fail if the CarrierPublicationProvider is unavailable, for example if
operating via an HTTP load balancer for bootstrapping.

Modifications
-------------
Changed HttpStreamingProvider to pass the user name to HttpServerConfig
rather than just the bucket name.

Removed the effectively obsolete HttpServerConfig constructor that
didn't accept authentication information.

Changed ConfigContextBase to accept a username and password and use
this for getting configuration, rather than using BucketConfig.Name and
BucketConfig.Password.  Passed this information from
HttpStreamingProvider.

Made BucketConfiguration.ClonePoolConfiguration also set the BucketName
and removed redundant calls to set the BucketName property after calling
ClonePoolConfiguration.

Removed the redundant calls to PoolConfiguration.Clone after the calls
to BucketConfiguration.ClonePoolConfiguration in HttpStreamingProvider.
These calls were effectively clearing several properties copied from the
BucketConfiguration, including the BucketName.

Changed MemcachedConfigurationContext to use ClonePoolConfiguration so
that BucketName is present for memcached buckets for SASL.

Added the internal property ClientConfiguration.ConfigurationProviders
to control which configuration providers are enabled during tests.

Added tests for authentication with only the HttpStreamingProvider
enabled and for memcached buckets.

Results
-------
RBAC authentication is now functioning against Couchbase Server 5.0 when
the CarrierPublicationProvider is unavailable.  Authentication still
functions in legacy mode against older servers.

Note: It might be worthwhile to make the ConfigurationProviders
configuration setting public in a future change to optimize bootstrapping
if the consumer knows that HTTP is the best choice.

Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>
Reviewed-by: Jeffry Morris <jeffrymorris@gmail.com>

NCBC-1443: Provide SDK endpoints to request the cluster version

Motivation
----------
Provide a consistent means to determine the cluster version via the SDK.
This is particularly important since the introduction of RBAC in 5.0,
since the endpoints that provide the version now require authentication.

Modifications
-------------
Created ImplementationVersion structure to represent the parsed
implementation version, with support for comparison operators.

Added ConfigInfo property to IConfigObserver to provide a way to access
the current configuration for a bucket.

Created internal ClusterVersionProvider class to handle getting and
parsing the implementation version at either the bucket or cluster
level.

Added GetImplementationVersion sync and async methods to IBucket and
ICluster.

Created unit and integration tests.

Results
-------
The cluster's implementation version can now be requested via an
ICluster or IBucket.  It is important to support both for the sake of
backwards compatibility.  Consumers implemented prior to 5.0 will only
have bucket-level authentication configured, using the bucket name as
the user name.  If they are targeting a 5.0 server, they'll need to
request the version via IBucket so it can use the bucket credentials.

NCBC-1405: Add support for enhanced error messages

MOTIVATION
----------
As part of server 5.0, the server can optionally include additional
diagnostic information for a failed KV operation. The additional
information will be specific to that operation and may include details
to reference server side logs for security sensitive errors.

As an additional note, responses that do not include the JSON bit should
not be read and converted into a response message, which is the current
behaviour.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- Add DataType enum flags and set it when reading response header
- Use DataType enum instead of DataFormat on Header (previously unused)
- Extend OpeationBase.GetMessage to read and parse the response when it
  indicates the body is JSON
- Append context and reference data to operation message and exception
  data values
- Add unit tests to verify behaviour (missing values, default values,
  exceptions, etc)
- Add integration test that works with CouchbaseMock to verify behaviour

RESULT
------
Failed KV operations will now read the response body if the JSON bit is
set to try and find additional context and reference information. If
found, this information is appended to the response message and also to
any exception data if present.

NOTE: This commit does change behaviour where the response body was
always converted to a string and returned if there was no other
information available. This commit instead defaults to returning the
Status Code if no other information is available.

object, so it remains zero; infinite expiration.

- Remove expiration from Increment ctor for consistency

Results
-------
If an operation is retried, Clone will copy the expiry so that it is
properly set for the document.

  that internall resolves to a DefaultTranscoder

  IClusterController
- Add unit tests to verify behaviour for both method variants

RESULT
------
When a NotMyVBucket response is received, the SDK will use a JSON
transcoder to decode the response instead of the custom transcoder.

NCBC-1451: ensure SelectBucket is called for every socket w/rbac

Motivation
----------
When RBAC is used with 5.0 and greater clusters, SelectBucket operation
must be called on every connection made to the server or an UnknownError
will be returned for any K/V operations. This also applies to connections
created after bootstrapping - for example in the case that a node is
swapped in and the cluster rebalanced.

Modifications
-------------
In order to make this work, some refactoring/layering of existing code had
to be done. Also, some new properties for passing bucketName and the
connections state were added. I would consider this a temporary fix and a
more elegant solution should be considered in the future.

 - Added BucketName property to PoolConfiguration so that it can be passed
   into SelectBucket from the connection
 - Moved the SelectBucket code from the CCCP provider to the connection
   level.
 - Added CheckedForEnhancedAuthentication property to the connection so we
   can bypass the SelectBucket operation after its been checked.
 - Added SupportsEnhancedAuthentication property to ConnectionBase and
   IConnectionPool
 - Added code to set the SupportsEnhancedAuthentication property in the
   CTOR of SharedPooledIOService
 - Override IConnectionPool.Connections in SharedConnectionPool
 - "Fixed" SSL and RBAC

Results
-------
When using RBAC SelectBucket is now called on every connection.

NCBC-1442: Refactor PooledIOService for SharedConnectionPool

Motivation
----------
SharedConnectionPool requires that the connection be explicitly released
back into the pool when the operation has completed IO so that the state
of connection can be checked to see if it is still good or perhaps needs
to be recreated if an IO or other error occurred. PooledIOConnection does
the same, but uses the older Connection type - for async operations the
connection itself will be released back into the pool when the call back
is called (its completed its IO) implicitly. The behavior difference
between explicitly or implicitly requires sub-classing or Type specific
logic; this commit provides specialization over Type specific logic.

Modifications
-------------
 - Added SharedPooledIOService class that derives from PooledIOService
 - Made async methods on PooledIOService virtual
 - Override async methods in SharedPooledIOService
 - Make shared fields protected

NCBC-1439: Fix race condition with opaque mismatch

Motivation
----------

Fixes a race condition between the Send thread public override
byte[] Send(byte[] request), Receive thread internal void ParseReceivedData(),
.NET Task queue and SyncState pooling. Chances for this to occur are increasing
with combination of high traffic, slow network and high utilization of Tasks
(so Task may be queued for longer time).

You can read the full synopsis here:
https://github.com/couchbase/couchbase-net-client/pull/72

Modifications
-------------
- Move the result assignment of SyncState from .NET thread pool into the
  receive thread.
- Ensure that setting results on the state is synchronized to eliminate the
  race condition in MultiplexingIOConnection

Results
-------
Resolves the race condition.

NCBC-1366: Fast-failover support

Motivation
----------
The upcoming Couchbase Server 5.0 offers a new feature called 'Fast
Failover' which allows failover to be configurable as low as 5s on the
server. This patch includes client-side support for FF by adding logic to
ensure that a config check only happens every 10ms to reduce spamming.

**NOTE: a future patch will be released as a .minor which will reduce the
HeartbeatConfigInterval from 10s to 2.5s to support the lower range of
support for FF on the server.

Modifications
-------------
 - Add ConfigMonitor class that encapsulates the logic for checking for
   configs at set intervals using CCCP only.
 - Add a centralized method on ClusterController called CheckConfigUpdate
   that can be called in the IO layer when certain classes of errors are
   encountered (Socket errors, etc).
 - Add a field called LastConfigCheckedTime which is used to ensure that
   there is a floor between checks so that the server is not spammed.
 - Add Endpoint to SyncState and bubble up so that the failed node can be
   omitted from the config check

Result
------
The SDK will check for a config update every 10s or when an IO
related error is detected. To reduce load on the server, the config check
will be limited to a single thread and will honor a floor of 10ms between
checks.

Motivation
----------
Some async calls in CouchbaseRequestExecutor and MemcachedRequestExecutor
use Thread.Sleep in their execution path where it is better to use
Task.Delay to better utilise the task API.
There were also some await calls that were not configured to ignore the
thread context which can cause additional overhead to wait for thread
synchronisation.

Modifications
-------------
Use Task.Delay in async calls instead of Thread.Sleep in the
CouchbaseRequestExecutor and MemcacheRequestExecutor classes.

Results
-------
Async methods will use Task.Delay instead of Thread.Sleep while pausing
between retries.

NCBC-1398: Reference to ClientConfiguration is null in PoolConfiguration

Motivation
----------
The PoolConfiguration holds a reference to ClientConfiguration and in some
cases, depending upon how you build your configuration, this value can be
null. This will cause a NRE while bootstrapping.

Modifications
-------------
In the ClientConfiguration.Initialize() method we check to see if the
property is null, if it is then we set it to the current
ClientConfiguration reference.

Result
------
A NRE will not cause bootstrapping to fail if the ClientConfiguration is
null.

Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/77358

NCBC-1393: async upsert hangs after removing entry point node

Motivation
----------
Fixes a bug where a cyclical deadlock can occur while doing a
failover/rebalance.

Modification
------------
Change from using a mutual exclusion lock on a private field to instead
use a latch, so that only one thread can enter the critical section at a
time.

Results
-------
Fixes the potential deadlock.

Change-Id: I2de8bd6d6de7aab55082aefa76d2497f9dc833a9
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/77357
Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>
Reviewed-by: Jaekwon Park <jaekwon.park@couchbase.com>

NCBC-1394: OperationTimeout and high mem consumption when swapping node

Motivation
----------
While doing a failover/swap and rebalance, the client may get in a state
where its cluster configuration is not current resulting in every request
becoming a NMV. This leads to OperationTimeouts and high memory
consumption while the client tries to process the body of every NMV.

Modifications
-------------
Change from using a Monitor to a mutex so that every request is checked,
and no cluster map changes are skipped by the conditional monitor.

Result
------
Every cluster map revision will be checked, so there is no possibility of a
skipped server config. The client should recover from a failover/swap and
rebalance scenario.

Change-Id: I41303ca95e2d39fb658462024ce991f3b2150e2d
Reviewed-on: http://review.couchbase.org/77326
Tested-by: Build Bot <build@couchbase.com>
Reviewed-by: Jaekwon Park <jaekwon.park@couchbase.com>

NCBC-1387: Add advanced FTS searching options

MOTIVATION
----------
An update to the FTS RFC includes new advanced sorting options for
search queries. The new sorting options describe a SearchSort pattern
where 4 sorting options have been defined. The update also includes an
option to provide a raw JSON object for future custom sorting.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- Add ISearchSort, SearchSortBase, IdSearchSort, FieldSearchSort,
  ScoreSearchSort and GeoDistanceSearchSort
- Add two Sort overloads to ISearchParams that take either an
  ISearchSort or JObject
- Change _sort field to JArray in SearchParams
- Add sort implementations to SearchParams that store the sorting
  options in the _sort field
- Add unit tests to ensure both new Sort options return valid JSON
- Add unit tests to ensure all new SearchSort implementations return
  valid JSON and omit default values

RESULT
------
There are two new ways of applying sorting to search queries. Firstly by
using an implementation of ISearchSort and this commit includes 4
implementations. The second option is to provide a custom JObject which
describes the behaviour and is to support future custom sorting.

NCBC-1389: Property to test for ClusterHelper initialization

----------

initialized.

Ensured that _instance is always set to null on Close.

Added unit tests for the new property.

Results

NCBC-1380: Retrieve and load KV Error map

MOTIVATION
----------
Error Map is new server feature where a dictionary of error codes and
descriptions are supplied to the client from the server. This
information will contain additional errors that the client does not
understand directly.

This is the first stage implementation where the ErrorMap can be
enabled and retrieved from the server. Unknown response codes check the
error map for a match with the details being added to the result
message.

A future commit will add more functionality, such as retry behaviour.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- Add ResponseStatus.Failure to indicate a server error with additional
  details to come from the ErrorMap
- Add ResponseStatus.UnknownError to indicate an unknown status was
  received from the server
- Add UseKvError property to indicate if the IO service should try and
  get an ErrorMap
- Add SupportsErrorMap to indicate the server supports KV Error Maps
- Request the XError feature during Hello operations if UseErrorMap is
  true
- Retrieve Error map and store in IOService if hello response indicates
  server supports Error Map
- Add unit tests to show IO services can use the Error map for unknown
  response codes
- Add integration test to ensure the client requests and stores the
  error map if UseErrorMap is true

RESULT
------
If the client configuration enables KV Error map and the server supports
it, IO service connects to the server it will also request an Error Map.
This is stored in the IO service and passed into OperationBase.Read to
use if the response was non-successful.

The operation's message is updated with the additional information from
the error code.

NCBC-1375: Default thread number to 3 when creating bucket connections

MOTIVATION
----------
When creating a bucket connection, a threadNumber property is sent in
the URI to indicate the number of threads to use for disk IO. This
currently defaults to 2, however the server takes this to indicate the
connection is to be treated as high-priority when it is should not.

The default should be 3 for low-priority, with 8 indicating
high-priority.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- remove ThreadNumber.Two enum entry
- replace all ThreadNumber.Two usage with ThreadNumber.Three

RESULT
------
When creating a bucket connection, the threadNumber defaults to 3, which
the server treats as a low-priority for disk IO.

NCBC-1341: Add RBAC authentication

MOTIVATION
----------
A new server feature is role based access control (RBAC) that provides
discrete user profiles with fine grained roles to services. The new
credential type utilises a discrete username and password for all
authentication processes.

Also, the original implementation does not follow the Cluster Level
Authentication RFC. It is likely it was changed post implementation and
should be updated to confirm to the updated RFC.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- Add IAuthenticator, RbacAuthenticator, ClassicAuthenticator and
  AuthenticatorType
- Add Cluster.Authenticate method that takes IAuthenticator
- Add SelectBucket operation and execute when retrieving bucket config
- Update ClusterController to separate bucket name and username fields
- Mark IClusterCredentials, ClusterCredentials and Cluster.Authenticate
  as Obsolete
- Add unit and integration tests to verify behaviour

RESULT
------
A new authenticator type is available that works with the new server
RBAC authentication process.

NOTE: The integration tests have been marked as ignored because the test
cluster is not capable of running those tests until has been updated.

NCBC-1351: Provide extensions to generate exceptions from responses

Motivation
----------
The approach of returning all errors as objects with success/failure
information is very powerful and flexible.  However, it can be somewhat
cumbersome for the consumer that simply wants an exception thrown if
there is an error.

Modifications
-------------
Add extension methods for each response type (both K/V types, view
query, N1QL query, and FTS query) which throw exceptions if the response
shows an error.  This exception includes details about the error
extracted from the response object.  If the response includs an
exception, this is made the inner exception of the new exception.

There is a specific exception type for each API (K/V, view, N1QL, and
FTS), all of which inherit from a base CouchbaseResponseException class.

Results
-------
Exceptions with error details can be easily thrown from responses if
that is desired in the consumer's implementation.  This loosely follows
the paradigm used by HttpClient's
HttpResponseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCode.

Example:
```
var response = bucket.GetDocument<dynamic>("key");
response.EnsureSuccess();
```

NCBC-1343: Automatically poll for query and search nodes to come online

Motivation
----------
If nodes are marked as down, they never receive new queries until all
nodes get marked as down.

Modifications
-------------
Implement ClusterMonitor which scans current cluster state for service
URLs marked as down every NodeAvailableCheckInterval.  Any down URLs are
tested and then reactivated if they succeed.

Cluster monitor shares a lifetime with the Cluster object.  Uses a ping
URL that is specific to each service and relative to each node's URL for
that service.

Added configuration setting EnableDeadServiceUriPing, defaults to true,
which enables this new behavior.

Removed query node ping from Server class.  Removed calls to MarkDown
for exceptions related to query, search, and analytics requests.

Results
-------
Query and search nodes which come back online will come back into use by
the client within the check interval, which defaults to every second.
Search nodes will only reactivate starting with Couchbase Server 5.0,
since the ping endpoint isn't available in 4.6.

The IsDown flag on the Server object is now purely for the K/V service.
The former behavior wasn't working correctly anyway, as most exceptions
where caught in QueryClient, SearchClient, etc.  The remaining
exceptions that would have triggered MarkDown would have been client
side exceptions rather than communication exceptions.

NCBC-1348: Fix single sub-doc operations against small values

Motivation
----------
If performing a Counter sub-document mutation against a samll value,
without any other mutations in the same operation, and with enhanced
durability disabled, the result throws an NRE when you try to read the
new counter value.

Similar results when trying to read short values with sub-document Get
operations, but for these it fails regardless of the enhanced durability
setting.

Modifications
-------------
Override GetExtras in SubDocSingularLookupBase to do nothing, since
lookup sub-document operations don't return extras after the 24-byte
header.

Override GetExtras in SubDocSingleMutationBase to use the MultiMutation
implementation of GetExtras which only looks for the MutationToken when
VBucket is non-null.

Results
-------
For all singular sub-doc operations extras are now read correctly,
allowing the value to be read correctly afterwards.  This results in the
Bytes property being populated so that calls to Content don't throw an
NRE when trying to deserialize the value.

NCBC-1339: Ensure an operation is retried when state is not connected

Motivation
----------
It's expected that a socket connection may be broken by either a network
glitch or because the remote host closes the connection (amongst other
reasons). This patch ensures that an operation will be re-tried if this
happens assuming that the operation could be retriable (get or set w/CAS) and if
the connection can be re-established.

Modifications
-------------
 - Added a TransportFailureException class to handle the case when an
 operation encounters a connection that is no longer connected. This is a
 temporary state unless the remote host (couchbase node) is determined to
 be down.
 - Added a IsConnected property to IConnection and implemented in
 ConnectionBase which returns the current connected state of the socket
 being used.
 - Reworked the logic in MultiplexingIOService so that if a socket is not
 connected, it will throw an exception of type
 TransportFailureException. This will trigger these operations to be
 retried.
 - The logic in OperationResult.ShouldRetry is changed so that
 TimeoutException and any TransportFailure states will be retried
 (unless thay are an operation type that cannot be retried).
 - Fixed unit test that was breaking due to change.

Results
-------
If a server connection goes down, the client will retry the operation if
it can.

Change-Id: I7d6fc49c265c764aa5f367ca5c20d360164188f5

 - If the server fails to respond within the configured timeout, return a

 - If a operation is canceled, return an OperationAbandonedException for

 Results

 If a server connection times out, any in-flight operation will be

 status of ClientFailure.

NCBC-1248: Add XATTR Support as Uncommitted

MOTIVATION
----------
A new server feature is to provide attribute storage outside of the

is to be done by extending the SubDoc API with additional Extras
flag to indicate if the operation is targeting the document or it's
attributes.

  the sucdoc commands attempts to use them

  flags are written for mutate and lookup operations
- Add Integration tests to prove mutate and lookup operations work with
  the server
- Added tests to ensure existing subdoc API is not impacted

RESULT
------
Subdocument lookup and mutate operations can now target the attributes
section of a Couchbase document.

NCBC-1279: N1QL query cancellation support

Motivation
----------
Allow long running N1QL queries to be canceled before they complete
using async task cancellation tokens.

Modifications
-------------
Added overloads to IBucket, IRequestExecutor, IServer, and IQueryClient
interfaces that accept a CancellationToken for N1QL queries.

Updated backing classes so that the original method calls the new method
overload, passing CancellationToken.None.

When a CancellationToken is actually passed into a method, pass this
down through the stack all the way to the HttpClient request.

Improved CouchbaseRequestExecutor.SendWithRetryAsync thread efficiency
by using Task.Delay instead of Thread.Sleep while waiting for an active
query node.

Added inner exception to PrepareStatementException when IQueryResult
returns an exception, allowing us to indicate a TaskCanceledException as
the inner exception.

Implemented an integration test to confirm behavior.

Results
-------
Existing public API is backwards compatible, only new methods are added.
Passing a CancellationToken and cancelling it cancels the HTTP request
for the N1QL query and returns a failed QueryResult with
TaskCanceledException in the Exception property.

NCBC-933: Use Microsoft Logging for .NET Core

MOTIVATION
----------
The SDK so far has used Common.Logging as it's logging abstraction
framework, however now .NET Core is not offically suported and their
beta work has gone stale.. Also, as part of the ASP.NET Microsoft have
introduced their own abstraction framework under the
Microsoft.Extensions.Logging package. This is designed to superseed any
exiting framework and even Common.Logging has acknowledged this.

This changeset introduces a joint approach where existing .NET
framework (net45) consumers will continue to use Common.Logging and
.NET Core (NetStandard) consumers will use Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.

We plan on moving completely to MS Logging as part of our next major revision.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- Add ILog as the main logging interface used throughout the codebase
- Add LogManager that uses conditional compilation flags to switch
  between Common.Logging for NET45 and Microsoft.Logging.Extensions for
  NETSTANDARD projets
- LogManager includes a ConfigureLoggingFactory method that is used to
  pass in a ILoggerFactory as part of the startup process
- Add CommonLoggingLogger and MicrosoftLoggingLogger as implementations
  of the ILog interface for each abstraction framework
- Replace all usage of Common.Logging with Couchbase.Logging
- Replace ILog usage of a delegate, eg Log.Info(m => m("")); as
  this is was a custom Common.Logging implementation and MS Logging
  doesn't support this

RESULT
------
Logging now works with both .NET framework applications using
Common.Logging and .NET Core applications using
Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.

NCBC-1258: Read properties before enumerating streaming query results

Motivation
----------
Currently, when using streaming query results accessing properties prior
to enumerating results throws an exception.  It would be helpful to be
able to check for errors, etc, without being forced to enumerate the
result first.

Modifications
-------------
The first time a property is accessed, read all attributes into their
properties up to the "results" attribute.  After enumeration of results,
if any, continue to read any remaining attributes.

Mark StreamMustBeReadException as obsolete.

Created integration and unit tests for the new feature.

Results
-------
During an error, there is no "results" attribute so all properties are
accessible.

During a successful query, only the "status" and "metrics" attributes
fall after "results".  We can assume status == success if there is a
results attribute, so only metrics remains unfilled until after the
enumeration is complete.

Note: If you execute both of the integration tests for this issue
simultaneously (Test_Streaming and Test_Streaming_Errors) the second one
will fail.  This is due to a separate issue, NCBC-1259, the test succeed
when run independently.

NCBC-1262: Improve Query request URI handling

Motivation
----------
The client previously used a random distribution for determining which
cluster node to send a query to. This commit changes to a round-robin
approach. Additionally, there was a bug where if a Uri was not available
the client would try to use null; this has been changed so that an
InvalidOperationException will be returned instead.

Modifications
-------------
Added null check incase GetQueryUri returns null. Also added a round robin
algorithm to help distribute the load. Added ability to set custom
QueryFailedThreshold in the config (Default value is still 2).

Results
-------
N1QL queries will be sent round-robin to each query node in the cluster;
if a valid Uri cannot be obtained, then an InvalidOperationException
will be returned to the application.

NCBC-864: Add JSON streaming ViewClient

MOTIVATION
----------
The default ViewClient processes all the rows of a view result into one
large collection and returns this. This is ok for small result sets,
however, computing these results in this way for larger results sets
(both number of rows and size of row) is both memory and CPU expensive.

It would be better to introduce a streaming version of the ViewClient
that can read each row one at a time, minimizing the amount of up-front
memory and CPU used.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- Add StreamingViewClient that supports streaming rows instead of
  processing the whole result set immediately
- Add UseStreaming method to ViewResult to instruct it to use streaming
- Add ViewClientBase to share logic between the original ViewClient and
  the new StreamingViewClient
- Add unit tests for ViewResult to check streaming is enabled
- Add Unit Tests for StreamingViewClient to check it can process results
  using streaming (includes test data)
- Fixed some BucketManager Tests that used an odd namespace that
  conflicted with View tests

RESULT
------
It is now possible to utilze streaming when executing a ViewQuery to
optimize the amount of memory and CPU used per row.

NCBC-1142: Query does not recover after service restart

MOTIVATION
----------
When a N1QL query is submitted to a cluster that is restarting, the
available Query URIs can be exhausted through retries until none
are left. However, when this happens an empty URI string is returned
which causes a InvalidOperationsException when trying to send to an
invalid URI with the HttpClient. Also, no logging is available to
indicate what has happened.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- In the case the QueryClient doesn't retrieve a valid URI when trying
  to submit a query, log out an error and return a failure result
- Add log message to ExceptionUtils for empty N1QL URIs
- Refactor GetRandom in ArrayExtensions to remove a duplicate and make
  the main implementation more clear

RESULT
------
If the QueryClient does not retrieve a valid URI when trying to submit a
query, it logs out what has happened and returns a failed request to
prevent further retries.

NCBC-1079: Add streaming N1QL response support

Motivation
----------
The current N1QL query client loads the entire response payload into
memory before returning the results. For small requests this isn't a
problem, for larger responses it invariable leads to
OutOfMemoryException's (OOM) when the collection storing the results
resizes and can no longer allocate contiguous memory for the collection.
This commit adds a streaming option which reads and serializes the JSON
response per item as the server returns the bytes.

Modifications
-------------
Added a a UseStreaming(bool) method to IQueryRequest for setting the
behavior to streaming. Added another property called IsStreaming to
determine if the response should be streamed. Added a
StreamingQueryReponse class that will read each item from the current
stream. IQueryRequest now implements IDisposable so that the response
stream can be disposed by the application after reading through the
stream.

In order to use any properties on the StreamingQueryResponse, you
must first iterate the result or call the ForceRead() method which will
iterate through the results creating an internal collection with all the
items. Importantly, understand this is essentially the same behavior as
QueryResult (non-streaming) and may lead to OOM exceptions. Note that
Success and HttpStatusCode can be read without calling ForceRead or
iterating on the response. If you attempt to call any other property on
the response object without call ForceRead or iterating over it, then an
exception will be thrown.

Results
-------
When IQueryRequest.UseStreaming(bool) is set to true, the client will not
buffer the entire response, but instead keep the stream open and read each
item on demand as you iterate through the results.

NCBC-1226: BooleanQuery JSON structure is invalid

MOTIVATION
----------
It has been found that the generated JSON when building a FTS
BooleanQuery query did not conform to the expected structure by the
server. The main problem was each sub-query was always being
wrapped in a "query" object. This worked for top level queries but
not when they are nested, eg BooleanQuery which contains must, must_not
and should arrays of child-queries.

In addition to this, some fields that should be omitted from the JSON
if they were unassigned or had a default value were still being
generated and sent to the server which could lead to unknown behaviour.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
- Remove SearchQuery.Export(ISearchParams) as it is not required.
- Update SearchClient to build the query JSON using the SearchParams,
  then add the "query" property using the Query.Export() method
- Update FtsQueryBase to default Boost to 1.0, make _boost private and
  make the Export() method create the initial JObject and apply "boost"
  if not default
- Update all Query implementations to remove Export(ISearchParams) and
  Boost overrides, use base.Export() to get the initial JObject and add
  it's properties to that
- Omit query properties that are optional where appropriate; field,
  analyzer, etc
- Update unit tests to fit with new pattern & expected output JSON
- Add unit to prove each query type's expected JSON output (TODO)

RESULT
------
The output JSON is what the server expects, particaulary around when
using nested queries such as BooleanQuery.

Fields that are optiontal are omitted from the JSON if they are
unassigned or have a default value.

NCBC-1101: Implement WatchIndexes for index managment

MOTIVATION
----------
The BucketManager had additional functionality added to allow management
of N1QL indexes (create, edit, list, etc) via RFC
(https://github.com/couchbaselabs/sdk-rfcs/blob/master/rfc/0003-indexmanagement.md).

As part of the spec, WatchIndexes were discussed with both synchronous
and asynchronous versions. This allows a developer to create indexes and
wait for them to become online but these were not implemented during the
initial development.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
Update the IBucketManager interface to remove the 'watchPrimary' bool
and consolidate watchTimeout and watchTimeUnit into a single Timespan
parameter for WatchN1qlIndexes and WatchN1qlIndexesAsync.

Add implementations for BucketManager, using a Thread.Sleep for sync and
Task.Delay for async.

Add unit tests to cover the following scenarios for both versions:
- Retries until indexes are online
- Retries until the timeout is reached and returns last result
- Stops if query fails on the server
- Stops if no matching index names are found

Update and consolidate method summaries and parameter descriptions
across IBucketManager, BucketManager and MemcachedBucketManager.

RESULT
------
WatchN1qlIndexes and WatchN1qlIndexesAsync now function according to the
RFC spec.

After the initial fix that was made to add validation of the MaxSize and

NCBC-764: Implement DNS-SRV

MOTIVATION
----------
DNS SRV records are used to manage changing application DNS endpoints
without having to change application config. Instead of storing DNS
names or IP addresses in config, a DNS SRV record is created and when
queried, describes a list of DNS registrations for use with a particular
service.

The .NET SDK does not currnetly support bootstrapping using an external
service, such as DNS SRV, and it should to provide parity with the other
SDKs.

NOTE: The .NET framework does not provide a consistent method to query
DNS SRV records. The typical way to do this was to use a third party
tool that likely imported a windows binary to allow the query to
execute. This is not ideal and especially now .NET Core targets
multiple OS platforms. Because of this, this implementation leaves the
majority of the work of retriveing the URIs to the consuming application.
This change provides the framework for allowing the bootstrapping to
happen and this has had the side effect that the bootstrapping process is
not limited to DNS SRV, but any external service could provide the
bootstrap URIs.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
Add IServerResolver interface for consuming applications to implement to
return valid URIs.
Add ServerResolverElement to hold the ServerResolver configuration.
Add ServerResolverUtil which is used during the Bootstrap process to check
the Couchbase config for a customised ServerResolver Type to bootstrap with.
Updated CouchbaseClientDefinition and CouchbaseClientSection with
appropriate properties.
Add DefaultServerResolver as a basic illustration for how to implement
an IServerResolver which returns a single localhost URI.

Add Unit Tests to cover the following scenarios:
- ServerResolver is not present
- ServerResolver is not valid (doesn't implement inteface / class doesn't
exist)
- ServerResolver does not return any URIs
- ServerResolver returns URIs
- ServerResolver is loaded from config file

RESULT
------
A custom implementation to source a seed list of server URIS to bootstrap
with can be provided as part of the client configuration. One implementation
of this could be DNS SRV.

NCBC-1204: CouchbaseClientDefinition should use interface for Buckets
property

MOTIVATION
----------
The .NET Couchbase supports configuration to be provided through a JSON
file at start-up. This is provided using IConfigurationProvider from
Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration. However, this implementation does
not support interface types when binding properties.

The original intention of this ticket was to replace the Buckets
property of CouchbaseClientDefinition to use List<IBucketConfiguration>.
However now the above has come to light, we feel it best to not to
modify the property type or we would lose the feature of loading config
from a JSON file.

NODIFICATIOS
------------
Add a unit test to prove that the current implementation can correctly
bind the Buckets property of the config and to act as a safeguard
against changing it in the future.

RESULT
------
Unit test coverage and explaination of why we chose not to change the
Buckets propety type have been added to the source code.

NCBC-1224: part 2 - IBucket level data structure methods

Motivation
----------
This is part two (2) of the Data Structures feature; the first one is
NCBC-1060 and is an API of Collections that are persisted to Couchbase.
This commit includes a new bucket level API for various data structure
methods for lists, sets and hashmaps.

Modification
------------
Add signatures for common data operations to be peformed on a data
structure: set, add, remove, etc.

Results
-------
In addition to the traditional IBucket key-value methods, there are now
methods which operate within the document on specific data structures:
arrays, sets and hashmaps. You use these like any other K/V methods,
except that they operate generally within the document and not on the
entire document (with some exceptions). Note that these methods are only
supported by Couchbase (peristent) buckets.

NCBC-958: Provide sane checks for max and min pool sizes.

MOVTIVATION
-----------
When creating PoolConfiguration you can specify the maximum and
minimum number of connections to create. These values are not checked
for approrivate values and can have a detrimental performance effect or
cause exceptions elsewhere in the SDK.

For the purpose of this ticket, I have set the minimum to 1 and maximum
to 500. I have also ensured the maximum is not smaller than the minimum.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
Made the MaxSixe and MinSize properties on Poolconfiguration to use
private sets. Added a constructor overload to set these where valiation
checks are executed, throwing ArgumentOutOfRangeException if required.

Managed the exception messages and creation through ExceptionUtil.

Updated useage where the public properties were used to set the max and
min sizes to use the new constructor.

Added tests to cover each scenario:
Max less than 1
Max greater than 20
Min less than 1
Min greater than 20
Min greater than max

RESULT
------
Validation is performed on PoolConfiguration to ensure max and min
connection values are appropriate.

MOTIVATION
----------
It is preferred to have a consistent interface across all SDK
implementations. The FTS ISearchQueryResult interface differs between
dotnet and Java, mainly by containing properties that have been added to
a sub class called SearchMetrics.

MODIFICATIONS

unused ReadFacets method on SearchDataMapper.

NCBC-1194: Bucket.Exists() returns False for valid key with non-standard chars

MOTIVATION
----------
Executing an Exists or ExistsAsync for a document that includes Swedish
characters always returns false, even if the document exists. This is
because the Write method on the ObserverOperation is not calculating the
byte array correctly and the buffer was too short which caused an
exception and a default value of False was returned.

MODIFICATIONS
-------------
Use the OperationBase method to calculate the key length in bytes, which
converts the Key to UTF8 first. This value is then used to calculate the
buffer array length.

Added test to prove non-standard UTF8 characters can be used in document
key.

RESULT
------
ObesrverOperations can now correctly calculate the byte buffer array for
keys with non-standard UTF8 characters which allows Exists and
ExistsAsync to execute.

Svizel -

Thanks for your submission! I was just going to address this. I am actually considering removing most if not all the finalizers. The purpose is/was to ensure that resources (namely sockets) get cleaned up if a caller doesn't explicitly call Dispose, hence the GC.SuppressFinalization calls, but it might be better to remove them. If they are removed, I am a little concerned that at the OS level, the sockets will leak and not close in a timely manner. In certain situations, this could cause bad things to happen at the server, if for instance, the client was being created over and over again. 

-Jeff

Yes, i agree that practically all of the finalizers can be completely removed. You really need a finalizer only in the classes which privately work with native resources. Even if you work with a System.Net.Sockets.Socket class, you don't need a finalizer because the Socket class has it. It shouldn't make a difference if you try to dispose the socket in your finalizer or let it get disposed by its own finalizer. It will remain open in the OS for roughly the same time.

Thanks much.

Ross

Jake -

Thank you for your submission, I'd like to merge this pull request into the main branch, but I need you to sign the Contributor License Agreement (CLA).  Can you follow the steps below tocreate an account and sign our CLA?

This is very unfortunate; what should I do now, having Document Keys containing characters and model Ids simply long integers?
I am not sure I follow; the only change here is to _not_ add an id if the type store is an array or collection, since it doesn't make sense to have an aggregate of singular values have an id itself.
Hello @jeffrymorris, using v1.3.5 I get a `NullReferenceException` in destructor (`Pool` is null) - any reasonable explanation?

dantandresh -

Well, it looks like a bug, however it shouldn't impact operational behavior of the client (let me know if I am wrong here). The reason being that the NRE will only happen when the client has been nulled or no longer referenced and the finalizer is being called during finalization. The reason the pool is null is because it's probably already been finalized or GC'd. 

I'll patch for 1.3.6 unless you want to do it and submit a pull request.

-Jeff

Will open the PR.
On 2 Jun 2014 17:22, "Jeffry Morris" notifications@github.com wrote:

> dantandresh -
> 
> Well, it looks like a bug, however it shouldn't impact operational
> behavior of the client (let me know if I am wrong here). The reason being
> that the NRE will only happen when the client has been nulled or no longer
> referenced and the finalizer is being called during finalization. The
> reason the pool is null is because it's probably already been finalized or
> GC'd.
> 
> I'll patch for 1.3.6 unless you want to do it and submit a pull request.
> 
> -Jeff
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/couchbase/couchbase-net-client/commit/cd7237431c46c5c1c87b49d551fc63a3d741bb3c#commitcomment-6525285
> .

Hi,
Could you tell me how to work with attachments?
@jeffrymorris I'm a little bit concerned about dropping the entire `bucketConfig` into the logs, considering it has credential information in it. This is definitely a security issue.

@benbenwilde -

Yeah, I agree. Its super useful for debug purposes, so maybe better if password at the least was omitted. TBH, this shouldn't be logged to INFO...maybe DEBUG only, since you really can't use DEBUG in production. 

I created a ticket here: http://issues.couchbase.com/browse/NCBC-920

-Jeff
Why is the max connections capped at 500? Can I set greater than that?

Hi @mcmugchu -

This is an arbitrary number that was chosen and his a sensible ceiling for connection pool sockets. Note that this is per node, so if you had 5 nodes and you maxed out at 500 connections then you would really be using 5*500 sockets! The problem here is that this creates resource demands on the CB server which can contribute to poor performance and even the app server. 

From testing we have found that in general, most apps perform with a much lower max 5-10 (up to 50) connections per pool.  Also note that the SDK has another IOService implementation called [MUX ](http://blog.couchbase.com/2016/january/couchbase-.net-sdk-2.2.4-now-available) which uses only 1 socket per node! This actually gives the best bang for your buck. 

-Jeff
When the bucket is a type of 'Memcached Buckets',the VBucket is null,so when executing 'Exists' operation, I get a exception.

Hi @jekeans 

Memcached buckets do not support VBucket's and therefore the underlying Observe operations are not supported (and fail as you describe). We've recently found this issue and have a pending [fix](http://review.couchbase.org/c/85060/) for that scenario on our Gerrit code-review system.

The only way to test if a value exists for a given key in Memcached is to try and *Get* it.

Thanks

review_comments.body: In the previous version of the code, this unit test will throw an ObjectDisposedException when one thread disposes the bucket another thread has been given.
In the previous version of the code, this unit test will throw an ObjectDisposedException when one thread disposes the bucket another thread has been given.
Are there any changes in the csproj other than formatting? If just formatting, can we ignore them for this commit?
I think it would be good if we could extend this class to be able to setup a custom MemoryStream using configuration (app/web.config) too.

Yeah, making this configurable would be a good idea but how would you envision this working? In it's current state, the only way to provide a custom `MemoryStream` is via a delegate. Would the config value accept a static method in the user's code base that was then called via reflection?

An alternative is to expand the scope of this PR and include the Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream package and then expose the various configuration knobs to the user (this was the main reason I didn't include the package as part of the PR- finding good default values for the size of the `byte[]` blocks allocated and the maximum size of the pool would be use-case dependent). What do you think?

I'd go for putting the MemoryStream type into config then during init create an instance of that type to use in the factory. It's a little bit of reflection but should only happen on start-up. 

We would only get the default values so if a user wanted to tweak specific implementation settings they would have to do it programatically. This way we support any implementation of MemoryStream without locking ourselves into a particular one

The issue with providing the name of a type in the config is that object pools like Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream require you to create `MemoryStream` instances using a central factory- you can't new up the `MemoryStream` implemented by this package. Or have I misunderstood you, did you mean that the config could accept the name of a method?

Ah, the Microsoft.IORecyclableMemoryStream doesn't have a parameterless constructor like System.IO.MemoryStream. That would be tougher to manage via configuration.

I think it's best we leave the configuration piece for now and we can come back to it.
Ok that might be for the best. Thanks for the discussion man, most welcome 👍
